Robust - Code Security
13/21
  • Type-safe reference casting
  • Structured memory access (no pointer arithmetic)
  • Array bounds checking
  • Checking references for null
  • Unspecified memory layout
What is Java ?

|X| Notes

The runtime data areas are the memory areas in which the JVM stores the data it needs to execute a Java application. The areas are:

  • Java stacks (one for each thread)
  • Method area (where byte codes are stored)
  • Garbage collected heap (where the objects created by the running program are stored)

Thus a cracker cannot predict, by looking at a class file, where in memory the data representing that class, will be kept. Furthermore he can't tell anything about memory layout by reading the Java virtual machine specification.
